job_description:

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Requirements

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.
  • Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: For applications, email your resume to careers@2basetechnologies.com
summary: Senior Business Analyst translates complex business needs into structured functional requirements, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure clarity and testable outcomes. Requires 4+ years of experience in SaaS or scalable systems with strong analytical and documentation skills.

job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

Company: 2Base Technologies

Role Overview We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps initiatives as we transition to a secure, scalable engineering environment. This role will strengthen our security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards across cloud/on-prem environments.
  • Conduct risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and mitigation.
  • Architect secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture and ensure secure design practices.
  • Monitor and respond to security threats, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures on AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • Secure containerized environments with Docker/Kubernetes and enforce baselines.
  • Implement monitoring/logging systems (SIEM, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK).
  • Optimize system reliability, scalability, and fault tolerance.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers on secure development and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA/PM/Engineering teams to align security and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years in DevOps/Cloud/Infrastructure engineering with security focus.
  • Hands-on CI/CD tools: Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions.
  • Expertise in AWS/Azure/GCP cloud platforms for secure architecture.
  • Proficiency in IaC tools: Terraform, Ansible.
  • Experience securing Docker/Kubernetes environments.
  • Networking expertise: LAN/WAN, firewalls, load balancers.
  • Knowledge of security frameworks: OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks.
  • Monitoring/logging tools: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM.
  • Scripting skills: Python, Bash, Shell.
  • Strong troubleshooting, analytical, and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Diploma/B.Tech/MCA in IT/CS/MCA.
  • SOC operations experience or SIEM/SOAR tools exposure.
  • Certifications: AWS Security/DevOps Engineer – Professional, CKS, CEH, CompTIA Security+.

Benefits

  • Growth-driven environment with leadership and innovation opportunities.

Contact: careers@2basetechnologies.com
summary: Lead cybersecurity and DevSecOps practices to secure cloud environments, automate pipelines, and mentor teams. Requires 4-8 years of AWS/Terraform/Kubernetes expertise.

job_description:

job_description:
Mid-Level QA Automation Engineer

We are seeking a Mid-Level QA Automation Engineer eager to advance professionally. You will contribute to building and maintaining automation frameworks, integrate tests into Azure DevOps pipelines, and explore AI-powered tools for intelligent test case generation. This role offers growth opportunities to expand technical expertise and take on increasing responsibilities.

Location

  • Trivandrum/Kochi

Notice Period

  • Immediate to within 30 Days

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain automation frameworks using Playwright, Cypress, or Selenium for UI testing and RestAssured or Karate for API testing.
  • Integrate automated tests into Azure Pipelines and learn CI/CD best practices.
  • Collaborate on test case creation and explore AI tools for test optimization.
  • Define and execute test strategies for functional, regression, and smoke testing.
  • Automate REST API validations and integrate with Azure DevOps Test Plans.
  • Contribute to performance testing using JMeter or Gatling.
  • Track defects in Azure Boards and assist in root cause analysis.
  • Learn to manage test environments with Docker and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).
  • Report quality metrics and grow skills in advanced reporting.

Growth Opportunities

This role is ideal for candidates aiming to deepen technical expertise, gain AI-driven testing experience, and progress toward senior-level responsibilities. Mentorship and leadership opportunities in small initiatives are included.

Required Qualifications

  • 3+ years in QA with 2+ years in automation engineering.
  • Proficiency in Java, Python, or TypeScript.
  • Hands-on experience with Playwright, Cypress, or Selenium.
  • Basic understanding of Azure DevOps Pipelines and Boards.
  • Familiarity with Git for version control.
  • Strong desire to learn AI-powered QA tools and advanced automation techniques.
  • Strong problem-solving and debugging skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with API testing tools like Postman or RestAssured.
  • Knowledge of performance testing tools (JMeter or Gatling).
  • Understanding of BDD/TDD concepts.
  • Exposure to BrowserStack or Sauce Labs for cross-browser testing.
  • Interest in service virtualization and feature flag testing.

Tools & Stack

  • Automation: Playwright, Cypress, Selenium
  • Languages: TypeScript, Java, Python
  • CI/CD: Azure DevOps Pipelines
  • API Testing: RestAssured, Karate
  • Performance: JMeter, Gatling
  • Management: Azure Boards, Azure Test Plans
  • Infra: Docker, AKS, Azure Cloud
  • AI Tools: Testim, Mabl, Functionize (learning encouraged)

Contact

If this aligns with your career goals, send your resume to careers@se-mentor.com.
summary: Mid-Level QA Automation Engineer needed to build automation frameworks, integrate tests into Azure DevOps, and leverage AI tools. Opportunity to grow technical expertise and lead CI/CD initiatives.

Senior QA Automation Engineer

We are seeking a Senior QA Automation Engineer with strong experience in Azure DevOps and advanced automation practices. This role involves designing scalable test frameworks, integrating automation into CI/CD pipelines, and leveraging AI-powered tools for intelligent test case generation, flakiness detection, and predictive quality analytics. You will ensure high-quality releases across web, API, and mobile platforms while driving innovation in test automation.

Location

  • Trivandrum/Kochi

Notice Period

  • Immediate to within 30 Days

Key Responsibilities

  • Build and maintain robust automation frameworks using Playwright, Cypress, or Selenium for UI and RestAssured or Karate for API testing.
  • Implement automated test execution in Azure Pipelines, configure triggers, and optimize parallelization for faster feedback.
  • Utilize AI tools for automated test case creation, flakiness detection, and predictive analytics.
  • Define and execute comprehensive test strategies for functional, regression, smoke, and integration testing.
  • Automate REST API validations and schema checks; integrate with Azure DevOps Test Plans.
  • Use JMeter or Gatling for load and stress testing; analyze results and provide recommendations.
  • Utilize Azure Boards for defect tracking and reporting; perform root cause analysis.
  • Leverage Docker and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) for test environments; manage test data and mocks.
  • Track and report KPIs like test coverage, flakiness, and defect escape rate using Azure Test Plans dashboards.
  • Guide junior QA engineers and promote best practices in automation and CI/CD.

Required Qualifications

  • 7+ years in QA with 5+ years in automation engineering.
  • Strong coding skills in Java, Python, or TypeScript.
  • Hands-on experience with Playwright, Cypress, Selenium, and Appium.
  • Expertise in Azure DevOps: Pipelines, Boards, Test Plans, and Artifacts.
  • Familiarity with AI-powered QA tools (e.g., Testim, Mabl, Functionize, or similar).
  • Proficient in Git and branching strategies.
  • Familiarity with Docker, AKS, and cloud-based test environments.
  • Strong debugging and problem-solving skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • BDD/TDD experience with Cucumber or SpecFlow.
  • Performance testing with JMeter or Gatling.
  • Security testing knowledge (OWASP, ZAP).
  • Experience with BrowserStack or Sauce Labs for cross-browser/device testing.
  • Familiarity with service virtualization and feature flags.

Tools & Stack

  • Automation: Playwright, Cypress, Selenium, Appium
  • Languages: TypeScript, Java, Python
  • CI/CD: Azure DevOps Pipelines
  • API Testing: RestAssured, Karate
  • Performance: JMeter, Gatling
  • Management: Azure Boards, Azure Test Plans
  • Infra: Docker, AKS, Azure Cloud; BrowserStack/Sauce Labs
  • AI Tools: Testim, Mabl, Functionize, or similar for intelligent test generation and optimization

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@se-mentor.com.
summary: Senior QA Automation Engineer leads test automation using Azure DevOps, AI tools, and frameworks like Playwright/Cypress to ensure high-quality releases across platforms.

Build a Strong Future Together

At LTS, we don’t just deliver solutions—we build long-term relationships. Together, we create a strong, sustainable future for our people, our clients, and our organization. From continuous learning and career development opportunities to meaningful ownership in your work, we support you at every stage of your journey. At LTS, your growth is our growth—and when our people succeed, everything we build becomes stronger.

You will work closely with the CTO, Delivery Managers, Business Analysts, and DevOps teams to ensure project success. Knowledge of AI tools to enhance the software development lifecycle is essential.

Key Responsibilities

1. Technical Leadership & Architecture

  • Own the technical direction and architecture of projects from conception to delivery
  • Design scalable, robust software architectures aligned with client requirements and best practices
  • Make critical technical decisions on technology stack, frameworks, databases, and integrations
  • Define technical standards, coding practices, and development guidelines for project teams
  • Guide and mentor Lead Developers on architectural decisions and implementation
  • Evaluate new technologies and tools that improve delivery quality and efficiency

2. Cross-Functional Collaboration & Coordination

  • Collaborate with CTO on technical strategy alignment, technology roadmap, and platform evolution
  • Partner with Delivery Managers to ensure alignment between technical delivery and project timelines
  • Work closely with Business Analysts to translate business requirements into technical solutions
  • Coordinate with DevOps teams for infrastructure planning, CI/CD pipeline design, and deployment strategies

3. Technical-Client Engagement

  • Act as the primary technical point of contact for clients and their IT teams
  • Conduct technical discovery sessions with client stakeholders and IT departments
  • Present and defend technical proposals, architecture designs, and implementation approaches
  • Build strong technical relationships with client IT teams and decision-makers

4. Project Planning & Technical Delivery

  • Lead end-to-end project delivery with strong technical oversight
  • Break down complex technical requirements into actionable development plans
  • Ensure projects meet scope, timeline, budget, and quality standards with OTIF delivery

5. System Design & Integration

  • Design complex system integrations, API architectures, and data flows
  • Define database schemas, data models, and migration strategies
  • Plan cloud infrastructure, deployment architectures, and scalability approaches

6. Technical Team Leadership

  • Provide technical direction to Lead Developers and development teams
  • Conduct technical design reviews and ensure adherence to architectural standards
  • Foster technical excellence and continuous improvement culture
  • Champion adoption of AI tools and best practices across teams

7. Risk Management & Quality Assurance

  • Identify technical risks, dependencies, and constraints early in projects
  • Define mitigation strategies for technical challenges and bottlenecks
  • Ensure code quality, security standards, and performance benchmarks are met

8. Stakeholder Communication & Reporting

  • Maintain transparent communication on technical progress, risks, and dependencies
  • Facilitate technical discussions across cross-functional teams
  • Prepare technical documentation for stakeholders at all levels

9. Pre-Sales & Technical Scoping

  • Support pre-sales with technical solution design and architecture proposals
  • Provide technical effort estimates and resource planning for proposals
  • Assess technical feasibility during sales cycles

10. Documentation & Continuous Improvement

  • Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation
  • Conduct post-project technical reviews and document lessons learned
  • Stay current with emerging technologies, AI development tools, and industry trends

Required Skills & Qualifications

Experience

  • Minimum 8+ years in software development and technical project management
  • Minimum 3+ years in technical leadership or software architecture role
  • Proven track record delivering complex, enterprise-scale software projects
  • Experience managing technical teams and Lead Developers
  • Strong client-facing technical experience
  • Experience collaborating with C-level executives and senior management

Core Technical Expertise

  • Software architecture and design: System architecture patterns (microservices, monolithic, distributed), API design (REST, GraphQL, WebSocket), database design (SQL and NoSQL), integration patterns and middleware
  • Development knowledge: Modern programming languages (PHP, Python, JavaScript), web frameworks (Symfony, Laravel, React, Angular), object-oriented design and design patterns, full SDLC understanding
  • Cloud and infrastructure: AWS, Azure, or GCP (AWS preferred), DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines, Docker basics
  • System integration: Third-party API integrations, real-time data processing (MQTT, message queues), security frameworks (OAuth, JWT, SSO)

AI Tools for Development (Required)

  • Experience using AI-powered tools for code generation, technical problem-solving, code review, documentation, and test generation
  • Understanding of prompt engineering, AI lifecycle integration, and best practices for AI-assisted coding

Project Management Skills

  • Expert knowledge of Agile, Scrum, and Waterfall methodologies
  • Strong project planning, scheduling, and resource management
  • Risk management and mitigation strategies
  • Proficiency with Jira
  • Change management and scope control expertise

Communication & Leadership

  • Excellent technical communication with developers and business stakeholders
  • Strong presentation skills for technical and executive audiences

  • People management and team leadership capabilities
  • Ability to translate technical concepts into business language

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong web application development experience across backend frameworks (Symfony, Laravel, Django, Spring Boot, Node.js), frontend technologies (React, Angular, Vue.js), RESTful API design, and cloud platform expertise (AWS preferred)
  • Database technologies: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB
  • Distributed systems: RabbitMQ, Redis, Kafka
  • DevOps: CI/CD pipelines, Docker, Infrastructure as Code
  • Security: OAuth, JWT, SSO, OWASP best practices
  • Pre-sales and solution consulting background
  • Track record implementing AI tools to enhance development workflows

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

  • People-First, Collaborative Culture: Ideas are heard, work is valued, and teams are built on trust and respect.

Build a Strong Future Together

At LTS, we build long-term relationships and support our people at every stage. From continuous learning to competitive benefits, we value balance, trust, and long-term success.

Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced U.S. Mortgage Underwriter to perform end-to-end underwriting activities across the mortgage lifecycle. The role involves reviewing and analysing mortgage loan applications for eligibility, risk, and compliance, making independent credit decisions, and providing final loan approvals. The Underwriter will collaborate closely with internal teams to ensure timely, accurate, and compliant loan processing while adhering to investor, regulatory, and company guidelines.

Key Responsibilities

Underwriting & Credit Decisioning - Review and analyse mortgage loan applications for eligibility, accuracy, and regulatory compliance. - Evaluate borrower creditworthiness, income, assets, liabilities, collateral, and Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratios. - Perform comprehensive underwriting analysis and make independent decisions on loan acceptance, conditions, or decline based on risk assessment. - Provide final underwriting approval on mortgage loans in line with delegated authority.

Loan Lifecycle Support - Perform underwriting analysis across the loan lifecycle, including: - Loan origination support - Underwriting coordination and review - Document verification and validation - Loan closing and post-closing activities - Ensure loan files are complete, accurate, and ready for closing within defined SLAs.

Compliance, Risk & Quality - Ensure all loans meet investor, regulatory, QC, and compliance guidelines (FHA, FNMA, FHLMC, VA, as applicable). - Identify discrepancies, conditions, and potential risk factors; clearly document and communicate findings to relevant teams. - Maintain accurate underwriting notes, checklists, and audit-ready documentation.

Escrow, Title & Servicing Support - Review escrow and title documents to ensure accuracy and compliance with underwriting requirements. - Support loan boarding and servicing by validating approved loan data. - Assist with default and foreclosure support by reviewing loan documents and underwriting decisions, as required.

Collaboration & Systems - Collaborate with processing, closing, QC, and servicing teams to resolve escalations and complex underwriting scenarios. - Manage loan files and underwriting workflows using Encompass and other Loan Origination Systems (LOS).

Preferred Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in any discipline.
  • 3–6 years of experience in U.S. mortgage underwriting or pre-underwriting.
  • Strong knowledge of US mortgage processes, underwriting guidelines, and risk assessment.
  • Hands-on experience with Encompass LOS and related mortgage systems.
  • Solid understanding of credit reports, income analysis, financial statements, and collateral evaluation.
  • Experience in QC, compliance, post-closing, and pre-purchase review activities.
  • Strong analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent documentation, communication, and stakeholder coordination abilities.
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

Preferred Qualifications

  • FHA, FNMA, FHLMC, or VA underwriting exposure.
  • Certification in mortgage underwriting or related fields.
  • Experience handling escalations, audits, or investor reviews.
summary: Seeking a U.S. Mortgage Underwriter with 3-6 years of experience to evaluate loan applications, ensure compliance, and manage underwriting workflows using Encompass LOS.

  • Familiarity with Docker, AKS, and cloud-based test environments.
  • Strong debugging and problem-solving skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Performance testing with JMeter or Gatling.

Tools & Stack

  • Languages: TypeScript, Java, Python
  • CI/CD: Azure DevOps Pipelines
  • API Testing: RestAssured, Karate
  • Performance: JMeter, Gatling
  • Management: Azure Boards, Azure Test Plans
  • Infra: Docker, AKS, Azure Cloud; BrowserStack/Sauce Labs
  • AI Tools: Testim, Mabl, Functionize, or similar for intelligent test generation and optimization

Job Title: Junior DevOps Technical Support Engineer Experience Required: 0.5 - 2 years Closing Date: 12, Feb 2026 Published Date: 29, Dec 2025 Contact Email: careers@reizend.ai

Salary Package: 4 - 6 LPA Work Location: Trivandrum (Work From Office)

Brief Description: We are seeking a proactive and highly skilled Technical Support Engineer to provide exceptional technical support for overseas projects. This role requires working in rotational shifts to ensure 24/7 availability, troubleshooting complex issues across cloud platforms, networking, application architectures, and DevOps toolchains. The ideal candidate must be self-motivated, collaborative, agile, and a continuous learner.

Key Responsibilities: - Provide technical support and troubleshoot issues related to Fargate, ECS, DynamoDB, BigQuery, SNS, etc. - Analyze logs and metrics using CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, Alert Manager, and Splunk. - Resolve networking challenges involving load balancers, API gateways, reverse proxies, ingress controllers, and service-to-service communications. - Address client-server communications, firewalls, and virtual machines. - Collaborate with DevOps teams to manage toolchains like Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, and Ingress Controllers. - Act as the first point of contact for technical queries and escalate issues when necessary. - Liaise with development and operations teams to identify root causes and resolve incidents. - Document troubleshooting steps and maintain a knowledge base for recurring issues. - Implement best practices for monitoring and incident response with cross-functional teams. - Participate in shift handovers and provide timely updates on ongoing issues.

Preferred Skills: Cloud Platforms and Services: - Hands-on experience with Fargate and ECS for containerized workloads. - Proficiency in DynamoDB and BigQuery for data analysis. - Debugging SNS message delivery and integration workflows.

Monitoring and Logging Tools: - Proficiency in CloudWatch Logs, Loki, and Splunk for log analysis. - Hands-on knowledge of Prometheus and Grafana for metrics monitoring. - Configuration of Alert Manager for alert escalation.

Networking and Security: - Troubleshooting load balancers (ALB, NLB), API Gateways (AWS API Gateway, NGINX), and reverse proxies (NGINX Ingress, Traefik). - Understanding of service-to-service communications (DNS, HTTP/HTTPS, gRPC). - Hands-on knowledge of firewalls, security groups, and IAM roles. - Troubleshooting VM-related issues (AWS EC2).

DevOps Toolchains: - Proficiency with Docker for container runtime debugging. - Knowledge of Kubernetes for deployments, ingress setups, and pod troubleshooting. - Experience with CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, ArgoCD). - Understanding of Ingress controllers (NGINX, Traefik) and SSL termination.

Troubleshooting and Incident Management: - Root cause analysis using logs, metrics, and system-level debugging. - Documentation of troubleshooting steps for recurring issues.

Collaboration and Communication: - Cross-functional teamwork with DevOps, development, and operations teams. - Proficiency in tools like Slack, JIRA, Confluence, and Google Workspace.

Contact: careers@reizend.ai for inquiries.
summary: Junior DevOps Technical Support Engineer with 0.5-2 years of experience required to troubleshoot cloud platforms, networking, and DevOps toolchains. Collaborate with teams to resolve incidents and ensure 24/7 support.

Address: Module No. 422, 423 and 424, Nila Building, 4th Floor, Phase 1 Campus, Technopark, 695581 Website: https://www.ecsfin.com Closing Date: 12, Feb 2026 Job Published: 29, Dec 2025 Contact Email: careers@ecsfin.com

About the Company

ECS Fin is an engineering enterprise specializing in process optimization. Our software solutions—enterprise messaging management system, SWIFT-certified transaction processing system, post-trade processing application, and treasury management system—are used globally by financial institutions and corporations.

Job Title

Java Architect

Location

Trivandrum

Experience Required

  • 8+ Years of experience in full-stack enterprise applications

Preferred Skills

  • 8+ years of experience with full-stack enterprise applications, including deep expertise in Java, Spring Boot, and distributed architecture
  • Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience in Spring/Spring Boot
  • Proven expertise in Maven and Git for managing large-scale codebases and DevOps integration
  • Strong command of Spring Cloud ecosystem (Config Server, Eureka, Gateway, microservice patterns)
  • Familiarity with Keycloak or similar IAM systems for federated identity and token-based access control
  • Working knowledge of integration frameworks like Apache Camel and workflow orchestration tools
  • Ability to design and guide Kafka-based streaming architecture
  • Expertise in API governance, documentation (Swagger/OpenAPI), and promoting secure/maintainable systems
  • Excellent communication skills with experience engaging international clients, mentoring teams, and driving architecture discussions in distributed environments

Note

This position requires working in a shift starting in the afternoon and ending late at night.
summary: Java Architect with 8+ years of experience in full-stack enterprise applications, specializing in Java, Spring Boot, and Kafka-based architectures for global financial solutions.

job_description:
Company Overview

ECS Fin is an engineering enterprise specializing in process optimization. Our software solutions include an enterprise messaging management system, a SWIFT-certified transaction processing system, a post-trade processing application, and a treasury management system used globally by financial institutions and corporations.

Job Details

Company: ECS BUSINESS SOLUTIONS (P) Ltd Location: Module No. 422, 423, 424, Nila Building, 4th Floor, Phase 1 Campus, Technopark, Trivandrum, 695581 Website: https://www.ecsfin.com Closing Date: 12, Feb 2026 Published Date: 29, Dec 2025 Contact Email: careers@ecsfin.com

Responsibilities

  • Work in a shift starting in the afternoon and ending late night.
  • Lead code reviews and act as a subject matter expert.
  • Propose technology solutions to project managers and clients.
  • Stay updated on the latest technological advancements and versions.
  • Write, deploy, and manage Spring-based REST APIs.
  • Conduct unit testing using JUnit and Mockito.
  • Utilize Maven for project builds and Git/GitLab for CI/CD workflows.
  • Debug and troubleshoot complex issues.

Preferred Skills

  • Mandatory: 5–8 years of Java, Spring Boot, and microservices architecture experience.
  • Mandatory: Proficiency in Maven and Git/GitLab for CI/CD.
  • Strong: Hands-on Spring REST API development.
  • Advantageous: Kafka for stream processing/asynchronous microservices.
  • Advantageous: Cloud-based environment experience.
  • Required: Oracle PL/SQL and relational database understanding.
  • Essential: Strong communication and leadership skills.
summary: Java Technical Lead role at ECS Fin in Trivandrum requires 5+ years of experience with Java, Spring Boot, and Maven. Responsibilities include leading code reviews and proposing technology solutions for financial software projects.

job_description:
QWY Software (P) Ltd

Location: Second Floor, Amstor Building, Technopark Phase1, Kazhakuttam, Trivandrum, 695581 Industry: IT/ITES covering E-com, Logistics, and Hyperlocal Delivery Services

Senior Python Developer - AI/ML

Closing Date: 30, Jan 2026 Published: 29, Dec 2025 Contact: careers@qwysoft.com

Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain AI/ML-based applications using Python.
  • Design, build, and deploy machine learning models and algorithms.
  • Work with large datasets, data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model tuning.
  • Integrate ML models into production-ready systems and applications.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and business teams to understand requirements and deliver solutions.
  • Optimize and scale ML models for performance and accuracy.
  • Stay updated with the latest AI/ML trends, tools, and technologies.

Preferred Skills

  • Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
  • 5-8 years of professional experience in Python development.
  • Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms (supervised/unsupervised, NLP, deep learning).
  • Proficiency with ML libraries such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc.
  • Experience with data manipulation tools like Pandas, NumPy.
  • Experience in model evaluation, validation techniques, and deployment.
  • Hands-on experience with APIs, Flask/Django for model deployment.
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Application: Share your updated resume to careers@qwysoft.com with the subject line: "Application for Senior Python Developer-AI/ML".
summary: Senior Python Developer (AI/ML) with 5-8 years experience building and deploying machine learning models. Requires expertise in Python, TensorFlow, and PyTorch for scalable AI solutions.
